intro: Nicipe britteniae, commonly known as the Britten's nicipe, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes species known for their medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, winged seeds. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Nicipe britteniae is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
